translations.english_saheeh: By the sun and its brightness
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the sun and its brightness.
translations.english_rwwad: By the sun and its brightness,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the moon when it follows it
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the moon as it follows it (the sun).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the moon as it follows it,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1931]- The earth. Also interpreted as the sun. The same applies to the following verse.

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the day when it displays it[1931]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the day as it shows up (the sun’s) brightness.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the day as it displays it,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the night when it covers [i.e., conceals] it
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the night as it conceals it (the sun).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the night as it covers it,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the heaven and Him Who built it.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the sky and how He made it,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the earth and He who spread it
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the earth and Him Who spread it.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the earth and how He spread it,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1932]- i.e., balanced and refined it, creating in it sound tendencies and consciousness.

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it[1932]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By Nafs (Adam or a person or a soul), and Him Who perfected him in proportion;
translations.english_rwwad: and by the soul and how He fashioned it,

translations.english_saheeh: And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then He showed him what is wrong for him and what is right for him.
translations.english_rwwad: then inspired it [to know] its wickedness and righteousness,

translations.english_saheeh: He has succeeded who purifies it,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed he succeeds who purifies his ownself (i.e. obeys and performs all that Allâh ordered, by following the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism and by doing righteous good deeds).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, he who purifies his soul will attain success,

translations.english_saheeh: And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed he fails who corrupts his ownself (i.e. disobeys what Allâh has ordered by rejecting the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism or by following polytheism or by doing every kind of evil wicked deeds).
translations.english_rwwad: and he who corrupts it will be doomed.

translations.english_saheeh: Thamūd denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thamûd (people) denied (their Prophet) through their transgression (by rejecting the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism, and by following polytheism, and by committing every kind of sin).
translations.english_rwwad: Thamūd rejected [the messenger] because of their transgression,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1933]- To hamstring the she-camel which had been sent by Allāh as a sign to them.

translations.english_saheeh: When the most wretched of them was sent forth.[1933]
translations.english_hilali_khan: When the most wicked man among them went forth (to kill the she-camel).
translations.english_rwwad: when the most wretched among them rose [to kill the camel].

arabic_text: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا
phonetic: 91.13 Faqāla Lahum Rasūlu Allāhi Nāqata Allāhi Wa Suqyāhā

translations.english_saheeh: And the messenger of Allāh [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allāh or [prevent her from] her drink."
translations.english_hilali_khan: But the Messenger of Allâh [Sâlih عليه السلام] said to them: "Be cautious! (Fear the evil end). That is the she-camel of Allâh! (Do not harm it) and bar it not from having its drink!"
translations.english_rwwad: Although the messenger of Allah warned them, “Hands off the she-camel of Allah and her drink!”

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
phonetic: 91.14 Fakadhabūhu Fa`aqarūhā Fadamdama `Alayhim Rabbuhum Bidhanbihim Fasawwāhā

translations.english_saheeh: But they denied him and hamstrung[1934] her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they denied him and they killed it. So their Lord destroyed them because of their sin, and made them equal in destruction (i.e. all grades of people, rich and poor, strong and weak, etc.)!
translations.english_rwwad: Yet they rejected him and hamstrung her. So their Lord destroyed them for their sin and leveled them to the ground.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1935]- Allāh is not asked about what He does, but His servants will be asked. See 21:23

translations.english_saheeh: And He does not fear the consequence thereof.[1935]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And He (Allâh) feared not the consequences thereof.
translations.english_rwwad: And He has no fear of the consequences thereof.
